description: T1. Lime:  Rear Garden: Tree Height 14m and crown spread 12m - A mature, tree, which is now sadly in decline, with extensive dieback in upper stems and is liable to fail. Also evidence of Kretzschmaria deusta, around the base, which causes a brittle rot. The combination of these elements, render this tree unstable, with potential to large branch failure.Fell in sections to ground level. G3 and G8. Cypress/Laurel Hedges: Rear Garden  Trim back 60/90cm of overhang to lawn garden: Tree heights and spread 5m. Leaving a spread of 4m.T4. Judas Tree:  Front Garden: Tree Height 5m and crown spread 4mPoor structure: Fell in sections to ground level.T5. Red Oak: Front Garden: Tree Height 19m and crown spread 17m - Reduce back branches extending over main drive to house to lawn boundary, approx. 2.5m Leaving a crown spread of 14.5m.Remove dead branches.Reduce back branches growing towards side elevation of no: 18 by 2m to balance crown. Leaving a crown spread of 12.5m.T7. Hornbeam x 2 Front of 19/20: Tree Height 4m and crown spread 3m Reduce height by 1m and crown spread 1m leaving a height of 3m and crown spread of 2m.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
